sys_update_xml.name: sys_ui_page_c024ce034f837100a0fc7d2ca310c705
sys_update_xml.payload:
generalChecklist to ensure that Splunk integration is installed correctlyfalsex_splu2_splunk_ser_Splunk Installation Checklist.do var myUrl = 'em_alert_list.do?sysparm_query=state!%3DClosed%5EsourceSTARTSWITHSplunk'; // Redirect here if the plugin is active var pm = GlidePluginManager(); var activated = pm.isActive('com.glideapp.itom.snac'); // Event Management activated; // This line returns the value into jvar_hasEventManagement var userGR = new GlideRecord('sys_user'); var integrationUsername = ''; var integrationUserID = ''; userGR.addQuery('active',true); userGR.addQuery('roles','x_splu2_splunk_ser.Splunk'); // Search for pre-existing users with integration role userGR.query(); var hasIntegrationUser = false; if( userGR.next() ) { hasIntegrationUser = true; integrationUsername = userGR.user_name; integrationUserID = userGR.sys_id; } hasIntegrationUser; var alertGR = new GlideRecord('em_alert'); alertGR.addEncodedQuery('sourceSTARTSWITHSplunk-'); alertGR.orderByDesc('sys_created_on'); alertGR.query(); var hasCreatedAlert = false; var alertSysID = ''; var alertDateTime = ''; if( alertGR.next() ) { hasCreatedAlert = true; alertSysID = alertGR.sys_id; alertDateTime = alertGR.sys_created_on; } hasCreatedAlert; var incidentGR = new GlideRecord('x_splu2_splunk_ser_u_splunk_incident'); incidentGR.addQuery('correlation_display','Splunk'); incidentGR.orderByDesc('sys_created_on'); incidentGR.query(); var hasCreatedIncident = false; var incidentSysID = ''; var incidentDateTime = ''; if( incidentGR.next() ) { hasCreatedIncident = true; incidentSysID = incidentGR.correlation_id; incidentDateTime = incidentGR.sys_created_on; } hasCreatedIncident;



Task NameTask DescriptionTask Status
Create integration user Your Splunk Integration account "${integrationUsername}" is already configured. Please use that user during the Splunk Add-on configuration task. Complete Splunk's server needs an integration account, so that it can create events or incidents into ServiceNow. This account must have the x_splu2_splunk_ser.Splunk role. This account username needs to be used during the configuration of the Splunk Add-on task. You can create the account right here:
Splunk Integration User:
Splunk Integration Password:

Enter a username and password, then click OK to create the integration account.

 		Not Complete
Enable Event Management plugin Great, Event Management is installed! Splunk works great with ServiceNow Event Management by creating highly-qualified events based on Splunk alerts that you define. Complete
Install Splunk Splunk needs to be running before it can send alerts to ServiceNow.
Option A: Install Splunk server on premise. You can download Splunk by clicking here. For more information on how to install and configure Splunk, please check out the Splunk Installation Manual.
Option B: Use Splunk Cloud. You can spin up a two week trial of Splunk Cloud instance for free by clicking here. 		N/A
Install and configure Splunk Add-on for ServiceNowThis Add-on is required by Splunk in order to create events and incidents in ServiceNow as well as polling ServiceNow records into Splunk. The Add-on can be downloaded from here. For more information on how to configure the Add-on, please click here. N/A
Install and configure Splunk App for ServiceNowThe Splunk App for ServiceNow is optional. Use this App to run analytics on your ServiceNow incident, problem, and change data.The App can be downloaded from here. N/A
Create Splunk Alerts Splunk has successfully integrated with ServiceNow. Here is the most recent alert it created at ${alertDateTime}. Complete Create Splunk Alerts From within your Splunk, you can configure as many alerts as you need. Those alerts will feed into ServiceNow's Event Management system. To create an alert in Splunk, please use either one the following commands: snowevent, snoweventstream or the snow_event.py scripted alert. For more information on these commands, please click here. Not Complete Create Splunk Alerts Splunk has successfully integrated with ServiceNow. Here is the most recent incident update it created at ${incidentDateTime}.From within your Splunk server, you can configure as many alerts as you need. Those alerts will feed into ServiceNow's Incident Management system. Complete Configure Splunk AlertsFrom within your Splunk server, you can configure as many alerts as you need. Those alerts will feed into ServiceNow's Incident Management system via the transform table and map that you already deployed as part of this Application. To create an alert in Splunk, please use either one the following commands: snowincident, snowincidentstream or the snow_incident.py scripted alert. For more information on these commands, please click here. Not Complete
]]>Splunk Installation Checklistsys_ui_pagegrant.hulbert@snc2015-03-31 17:45:28c024ce034f837100a0fc7d2ca310c705135Splunk Installation Checklistbac6db564f6a3100a0fc7d2ca310c721bac6db564f6a3100a0fc7d2ca310c721sys_ui_page_c024ce034f837100a0fc7d2ca310c705admin2017-11-03 17:55:08

sys_update_xml.name: sys_ui_page_e653ca034f837100a0fc7d2ca310c736
sys_update_xml.payload: generalAutomatically shows active Alerts when Event Management plugin is activated. Otherwise, shows Splunk-created incidents.falsex_splu2_splunk_ser_Splunk Alerts.do var myUrl = 'em_alert_list.do?sysparm_query=state!%3DClosed%5EsourceSTARTSWITHSplunk'; // Redirect here if the plugin is active var pm = GlidePluginManager(); var activated = pm.isActive('com.glideapp.itom.snac'); // Event Management activated; // This line returns the value into jvar_hasEventManagement Because your ServiceNow instance does not have Event Management installed, you will not be able to view the list of alerts. Splunk works well with ServiceNow, whether or not you have installed Event Management, but you will need to configure your Splunk server to generate Incidents directly, without going through the Alert Console. ]]>Splunk Alertssys_ui_pagegrant.hulbert@snc2015-03-31 17:42:06e653ca034f837100a0fc7d2ca310c7368Splunk Alertsbac6db564f6a3100a0fc7d2ca310c721bac6db564f6a3100a0fc7d2ca310c721sys_ui_page_e653ca034f837100a0fc7d2ca310c736grant.hulbert@snc2015-04-06 23:06:00

sys_update_xml.payload:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update sys_domain="global" table="sys_script"><sys_script action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><abort_action>false</abort_action><access>package_private</access><action_delete>false</action_delete><action_insert>true</action_insert><action_query>false</action_query><action_update>true</action_update><active>true</active><add_message>false</add_message><advanced>true</advanced><change_fields>false</change_fields><client_callable>false</client_callable><collection>em_alert</collection><condition>String(current.source).indexOf("Splunk") != -1</condition><description/><execute_function>true</execute_function><filter_condition table="em_alert">sourceLIKESplunk^additional_infoLIKEurl^additional_infoLIKEcorrelation_id^EQ<item endquery="false" field="source" goto="false" newquery="false" operator="LIKE" or="false" value="Splunk"/><item endquery="false" field="additional_info" goto="false" newquery="false" operator="LIKE" or="false" value="url"/><item endquery="false" field="additional_info" goto="false" newquery="false" operator="LIKE" or="false" value="correlation_id"/><item endquery="true" field="" goto="false" newquery="false" operator="=" or="false" value=""/></filter_condition><is_rest>false</is_rest><message/><name>Splunk Events Forward</name><order>800</order><priority>100</priority><rest_method/><rest_method_text/><rest_service/><rest_service_text/><rest_variables/><role_conditions/><script><![CDATA[function onBefore(current, previous) {
   //This function will be automatically called when this rule is processed.
   var additionalInfo = (new global.JSON()).decode(current.additional_info);
   var gr = new GlideRecord("incident");
	if(gr.get(current.incident) ) {
		gr.x_splu2_splunk_ser_splunk_url = additionalInfo.url;
		gr.correlation_id = additionalInfo.correlation_id;
		gr.correlation_display = "Splunk";
		gr.update();
	}
}]]></script><sys_class_name>sys_script</sys_class_name><sys_created_by>danny.kibel@snc</sys_created_by><sys_created_on>2015-03-11 23:55:23</sys_created_on><sys_domain>global</sys_domain><sys_domain_path>/</sys_domain_path><sys_id>2c8718704f367100a0fc7d2ca310c743</sys_id><sys_mod_count>14</sys_mod_count><sys_name>Splunk Events Forward</sys_name><sys_overrides/><sys_package display_value="Splunk Integration" source="x_splu2_splunk_ser">bac6db564f6a3100a0fc7d2ca310c721</sys_package><sys_policy/><sys_scope display_value="Splunk Integration">bac6db564f6a3100a0fc7d2ca310c721</sys_scope><sys_update_name>sys_script_2c8718704f367100a0fc7d2ca310c743</sys_update_name><sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by><sys_updated_on>2015-03-23 22:10:03</sys_updated_on><template/><when>before</when></sys_script><sys_translated_text action="delete_multiple" query="documentkey=2c8718704f367100a0fc7d2ca310c743"/></record_update>

sys_update_xml.name: sys_ui_page_c51c6d3e4f8f3100a0fc7d2ca310c763
sys_update_xml.payload:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update table="sys_ui_page"><sys_ui_page action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><category>general</category><client_script/><description>Automatically shows Event Management dashboard when Event Management plugin is activated. Otherwise, shows Splunk-created incidents.</description><direct>false</direct><endpoint>x_splu2_splunk_ser_Splunk Overview.do</endpoint><html><![CDATA[<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?>
<j:jelly trim="false" xmlns:j="jelly:core" xmlns:g="glide" xmlns:j2="null" xmlns:g2="null">
<g2:evaluate>
var myUrl = 'incident_list.do?sysparm_query=correlation_display%3DSplunk'; // Redirect here if the plugin is not active
var pm = GlidePluginManager();
	var act = pm.isActive('com.glideapp.itom.snac'); // Event Management
if (act) {
	myUrl = 'home.do?sysparm_view=Splunk';  // Redirect here if the plugin is active
}
	//myUrl;
</g2:evaluate>
<META http-equiv="refresh" content="0;URL=$[myUrl]"/>
</j:jelly>]]></html><name>Splunk Overview</name><processing_script/><sys_class_name>sys_ui_page</sys_class_name><sys_created_by>grant.hulbert@snc</sys_created_by><sys_created_on>2015-03-30 21:23:25</sys_created_on><sys_id>c51c6d3e4f8f3100a0fc7d2ca310c763</sys_id><sys_mod_count>5</sys_mod_count><sys_name>Splunk Overview</sys_name><sys_package display_value="Splunk Integration" source="x_splu2_splunk_ser">bac6db564f6a3100a0fc7d2ca310c721</sys_package><sys_policy/><sys_scope display_value="Splunk Integration">bac6db564f6a3100a0fc7d2ca310c721</sys_scope><sys_update_name>sys_ui_page_c51c6d3e4f8f3100a0fc7d2ca310c763</sys_update_name><sys_updated_by>grant.hulbert@snc</sys_updated_by><sys_updated_on>2015-03-30 22:21:27</sys_updated_on></sys_ui_page></record_update>
